title: 06. Athens and her Empire
description: Athenian imperial control, criticism, and decision-making during the fifth century BCE.

questions.question: How does the Old Oligarch characterise Athens’ treatment of allied oligarchies?
What economic criticism does the Old Oligarch make about Athenian tribute policy?
options: Tribute was too low to be effective
Athens charged excessive tribute regardless of allies’ ability to pay
Tribute was shared equally among allies

questions.question: Why does the Old Oligarch claim Athens wanted allies to be financially weak?
Why must historians treat this claim with caution?
What legal practice does the Old Oligarch criticise regarding allied states?
options: Forcing allies to come to Athens for trials

questions.question: What motive does the Old Oligarch attribute to this legal policy?
options: Extracting rent and tax from visitors

questions.question: What alternative explanation for this policy is suggested in the PPT?
options: It protected democratic allies from oligarchic abuse

questions.question: Why would the Old Oligarch be unlikely to acknowledge this explanation?
options: His political views were hostile to democracy

questions.question: When did the Mytilene Debate take place?
What was Mytilene’s status within the Athenian Empire before the revolt?
What type of governments controlled most cities on Lesbos?
Which city on Lesbos remained democratic and loyal to Athens?
Who led the Athenian force sent against Mytilene?
What was the initial decision of the Athenian Assembly regarding punishment?
options: Execution of men and enslavement of women and children

questions.question: Who argued for a more lenient policy in the second debate?
What ultimately happened to the Mytileneans?
options: Only the revolt leaders were executed

questions.question: What does the Mytilene Debate reveal about Athenian imperial decision-making?
options: It could be harsh, impulsive, but also self-correcting
